Record.ClassificationPath: Findings_and_Disorders_Kind/Disease, Disorder or Finding/Finding/Finding by Site or System/Cardiovascular System Finding/Aneurysm/Ruptured Aneurysm
Record.Description: The tearing or bursting of the weakened wall of the aneurysmal sac, usually heralded by sudden worsening pain. The great danger of a ruptured aneurysm is the large amount of blood spilling into the surrounding tissues and cavities, causing HEMORRHAGIC SHOCK.
